definitions.definition: handle or control (a tool, mechanism, etc.), typically in a skillful manner.
examples: he manipulated the dials of the set
synonyms: pull "he manipulated some knobs and levers"

definitions.definition: alter, edit, or move (text or data) on a computer.
examine or treat (a part of the body) by feeling or moving it with the hand.
examples: a system of healing based on manipulating the ligaments of the spine
synonyms: palpate "she manipulated the muscles of his back"

definitions.definition: control or influence (a person or situation) cleverly, unfairly, or unscrupulously.
examples: the masses were deceived and manipulated by a tiny group
synonyms: gerrymander; twist someone around one's little finger "the government tried to manipulate the situation"

definitions.definition: alter (data) or present (statistics) so as to mislead.
examples: falsify, rig, distort, alter, change, doctor, massage, juggle, tamper with, tinker with, interfere with, misrepresent; Moreinformalcook, fiddle with "they accused him of manipulating the data"Morecook, fiddle with they accused him of manipulating the data
